alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:29PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A developing line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Moore, southwestern Harnett, western Cumberland and northern Hoke Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 926 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raeford, moving northeast at 40 mph. This storm was part of a line of storms developing across south central North Carolina, from near Southern Pines to just south of Fayetteville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Southern Pines, Fort Bragg, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Eastover and Whispering Pines. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
